creator: gvt.public@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 30381
Small build.xml to reproduce the bug.

The ManifestClassPath task improperly translates the JAR's parent directory to '/', where the expected result is '.' (cf. attached build.xml to reproduce).

NOTE: The same beavior has been observed with other Ant version: 1.7.1, 1.8.1 and 1.8.4 (on Windows and Linux with different JVM).

creator: gvt.public@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 30403
Proposed patch (with unit test)

With the patch applied, the <ManifestClasspath> task returns "./" for a classpath element that corresponds to the directory of the jarfile attribute.
